prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Mr. and Mrs. James Hoover Collection, Collection #sc2062, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated to Carrier Library by Mrs. James Hoover of Harrisonburg in May, 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two Hollinger boxes and a few oversize materials, 1770-1963, dealing largely with the Strickler family of Massanutten, Egypt, and Luray, in what in 1831 became Page County, VA, and a few related families. Abraham Strickler was one of the original settlers of the Shenandoah Valley at Massanutten (now Page County) in the 1720s. His descendants figured prominently in the life of the region. There are scattered documents relevant to related families, especially the Civil War correspondence of the Kauffmans, but the bulk of the collection documents parts of the lives of two Mary Stricklers (1860s, 1907- 1940s); Joseph and Joseph T. Strickler (1810-1856, 1890s); and Baptist Elder Reuben T. Strickler (1881-1903). There is also some correspondence concerning the Strickler land claim and experiences in Oregon and Washington Territory (1860s-1880s).
Another collection, SC# 2088, Milbourne, L.R. Letters contains materials relevant to Virginia Strickler in the 1880s.

did.unittitle: 1: Letters and Genealogy 1770s-1963

From surnames Coffman, Ward, Crim, and others, mostly to Strickler family in Luray; mention of land purchases in the Valley, typhoid fever, farm and financial news. A few from Oregon concern prospecting in Rouge River. Includes an autograph copy of a letter from A. Strickler at University of VA to Dr. Thomas (Dec. 10, 1835). 1835-60 and undated.

Mostly between Robert G. Mauck in Page County and nephews Joseph F. and E.V. Kauffman and brother John W. Mauck, all in the 10th VA Reg., who wrote from various camps of camp life and troop movements. R. Mauck writes of farm news and "excitement and rumors of all kinds" (June 24, 1861). 1861-62.
Several from E.V. Kauffman from camp. Most of rest are to Mary Strickler from grandson Will concerning death in family. Mention of Cambellites (Sept. 1, 1866). 1863-66 and undated
Mostly to Mary Strickler at Massanutten, including from grandson Will in Washington D.C. Details of W.A. Strickler's land claim in Washington Territory and his disappearance. 1867-69.
Friends and Strickler family in VA, WV, OH, NV, IL, MO, KS; two items related to Mill Creek Church (1874, 1879). 1870-78 and undated
Mostly from W.S. Strickler in NV, where he was working, prospecting and mining, to brother Reuben T. and other relatives in VA. 1880-82.
Mostly from W.S. and J.G. Strickler in NV and Dakota to relatives in Page Cty; a few from Joshua Ruffner in ID and MT to VA. Several items related to Mill Creek Church. 1883-86 and undated
Mostly to Reuben T. Strickler from relatives and Baptist Church members. 1887-1903 and undated

Mostly from family and friends with news of home to Mary Strickler, in Page County and later in Washington, D.C. One of Mary's school compositions (1913?) mentions gypsies in Page Cty. Some items incomplete. 1907-18.
Con't previous file; includes documents related to Mary Strickler's husband S.B. (Beery) Hoover; letters to Litha Strickler. 1919-44.

Genealogy, 1770s-1963 but mostly undated Separated page from Bible with Brewbaker genealogy, 1700s; fragment of Pulliam genealogy, 1770-1820s; Strickler genealogy incl. facsimile of 1885 statement of Adam Strickler; Hoover and Ridgeway families by Media Research Bureau of Washington, D.C.; Cornwell family by Mary Hoover, 1947, and other Cornwell items; 1905 book, History and Descendants of Abraham Beery by Jos. W. Wenger.
2: Business and Legal documents.

Business receipts, 1810-[1890]-1928. Property tax receipts of Jos. Strickler, 1810-1827; property tax receipts of Mary Rooff (adm. Jos. Strickler), 1810-1832; 1813 birth verification of Negro girl; inventory of Jos. Strickler estate, 1856; inventories and receipts for estate of Jos. T. Strickler, 1890 (see also Oversize); misc. other items.
Seven Railroad timetables (some with route maps), 1880s. Includes Shenandoah Valley Route and several other Virginia routes.

Lists of land and property taxes in district of Jos. Strickler, Commissioner of Revenue for Shenandoah Cty, 1815 (see also Oversize), '17, '19, '21, '22, '23, '26 (?, with list of licenses issued), '27, and undated
Ledgers. Debt/interest ledger (?), Jos. Strickler (?), 1821-26; bound with store/labor ledger, Jos. and Jos. T. Strickler (?), 1835-1864. See also Oversize.
3: Miscellaneous.

Includes religious pamphlet by J.G. Strickler (2 cop.), Minutes of Ebenezer Baptist Assoc. sessions (65,68,69,76, 1893-1904), Luray and Bridgewater newsletters (1885-93), and unidentified printed German poem.
4: Oversize.
Store/labor ledger, John Mauk (?), 1818-25; unknown, 1866-1889. List of property taxes, 1815. Broadside advertising estate sale of J.T. Strickler, 1889.
